sense.gloss: diatomaceous earth, diatomite, siliceous marl, kieselguhr
to struggle, to writhe, to wriggle, to squirm
to act frantically, to make desperate efforts
wakame (species of edible brown seaweed, Undaria pinnatifida)

sdata.j: 「↑今日↑↓きょう↓ね、↑久↑↓ひさ↓しぶりに↑海藻↑↓かいそう↓を↑食↑↓た↓べてみたんだけど、↑美味↑↓おい↓しかった」「↑日本↑↓にほん↓ではよく↑食卓↑↓しょくたく↓にあがるんだけど、アメリカではあまりあがらないの？」「↑普通↑↓ふつう↓の↑家↑↓いえ↓ではよく↑出↑↓で↓てるみたいだよ。でも、↑僕↑↓ぼく↓んちではあまり↑出↑↓で↓てこないよ」
sdata.e: I tried some seaweed today after not eating any for a while, and it was delicious. "In Japan, it's often part of a meal. Is that less common in the U.S.?" "I think it's common in most families, but not really in mine."

words.gloss: diatomaceous earth, diatomite, siliceous marl, kieselguhr
